## Lease of Portable VHF Radio Sets

### Announcement Reference
WS4167388841-Doc4167631262

### Amendment Number
1

### Tender Closing Date
October 25, 2023, 2:00 PM EDT

### Contract Details

* Lease duration: Two years and two months with three one-year options
* Interoperability requirement: Non-secure mode with other military-specific radios in the same frequency band
* Canadian origin requirement: 80% of goods and/or services

### Tender Description

The Department of National Defence (DND) is seeking a short-term lease of portable VHF radio sets. The equipment must be capable of interoperating in a non-secure mode with other military-specific radios in the same frequency band. The lease duration is two years and two months, with three one-year options.

### Contact Information

For questions regarding this tender, please contact:
Matthew Havrilenko
matthew.havrilenko@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca

### To Respond

Please disregard the Ariba Discovery posting response deadline closing time and CanadaBuys posting closing time. All required supporting documentation and bid submission must be submitted by October 25, 2023, at 2:00 PM EDT. Late bids will be declared non-responsive.

### Cancellation Reason
A procurement category according to the Trade Agreement is Competitive - Open bidding (MCA-M).

### Trade Agreements
* Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)

### Regions of Delivery
* Calgary
* Winnipeg
* Vancouver

### Important Notes
* The tender document and all supporting documentation must be in English.

This is a sole source scheduled procurement, originating from sectoral arrangements. Successful Bidders may be subject to compliance with the Iran (Financial Sanctions) Regulations-2011).



The company I work for is a government agency. We are seeking proposals for portable VHF radio sets. We need these sets to be able to communicate in a non-secure mode with other military radios in the same frequency band.

We are looking for a short-term lease with an initial term of two years and two months, as well as three additional one-year options. The proposal must demonstrate that at least 80% of the goods and services are of Canadian origin.

We expect the contract to commence on an expected start date of [TBD] and end on an expected end date of March 31, 2026.

If you have any questions or would like to submit a proposal, please contact Matthew Havr
